  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51155].
  {panel}

In certain situations where event information is sensitive, it may be preferable that users can see if someone is free/busy, without knowing exactly what is keeping them busy.
This type of situation is supported by the iCalendar VFREEBUSY object type.
The object type is used by Google Apps calendars where the organisation has prohibited the public disclosure of event information.
Team Calendars should support the VFREEBUSY object type in import files and also in the subscriptions.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51124].
  {panel}

*Support pain point!* Documentation is not obvious/clear for users of Team Calendars coming from old calendars on how to create/add calendars. 

Under https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Using+Team+Calendars#UsingTeamCalendars-AddingtotheCalendar there are 3 links that are not clearly identified on being the instructions for creating a calendar, while it says add calendar, this is not the same as in the original calendars and can be confusing for users. Support answers the same questions every week explaining the difference in the new TC. Customers typically go to a page and try to Insert Macro > Team Calendar and then try to create the calendar on the fly on that specific page. Then when support directs the customer to the documentation mentioned above, customers still don't get it.

I would recommend adding an informative message to the box to insert macro > team calendar with something like:

(i) If you have not yet created the calendar you are trying to add to this page, navigate to User Menu > Calendar > Add Calendar and create the calendar first. You can then insert a macro on this page referencing the target calendar. 

While some customers understand the new process, I would say at least 5-10 tickets a week are created to address this or the question is asked in conjunction with an existing support request. It is time consuming to explain the same thing over and over and I don't believe our documentation does a good job explaining how to create a calendar. 'Adding a Calendar' should be one of the first sections in the docs since this would be the first thing users do when using TC for the first time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51101].
  {panel}

On our site's dashboard I have a calendar macro defined as:

{code}{calendar:id=8f564b4b-afed-4ceb-b206-2e426f595648,a80c628d-5155-40bc-8a55-0874fb77bf71}{code}

The result is something that looks like this:
!User with View Rights.JPEG!

After using the new features from TEAMCAL-102 to restrict view access of one of those calendars, users who don't have view rights to that calendar now see a huge warning on our site:
!User without View Rights.JPEG!

I believe the appropriate user experience would be to see no errors and no indication that there is a calendar that they do not have access to.  I understand this has to be balanced with the requirement for editors to know if they fat-finger a calendar id in their macros when editing, and the error is probably useful then.  But big red boxes on dashboards are worse.

Marking as critical because I believe this is a significant bug that will impact many users as they begin to utilize the new features from TEAMCAL-102.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51035].
  {panel}

Team Calendars will always have limited "Advanced" editing possibilities, but luckily we can export and import (using ics files).

However there seems not to exist a 'remove all events' feature. This is needed if one performed major updates (i.e. replaced a single word in all events)

As a result one needs to remove the whole calendar and add the import the updated ics file to a new calendar. This has several unwanted side affects:
* breaks all existing user subscriptions / configurations (like color selection)
* breaks all watches
* on deletion an ics file is sent to all subscribers. They don't understand why this is and it's obviously not interesting to them.

To complete the circle an email could be sent to the watchers that this calendar is re-imported (I don't think it'll be a requirement to know the exact differences)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51027].
  {panel}

At the moment, the Team Calendars starting day of the week is configured by the users locale. We've run into a few problems with this:

1. There isn't a simple way for admins to change the locale for everyone (CONF-16057, TEAMCAL-318)
2. Some customers don't necessarily want it to respect the locale TEAMCAL-466.

This issue is to look at solving this problem. Proposed solution:

1. Global setting for "start day of the week" (defaults to whatever the locale is)
2. This can be overridden by a user setting for start day of the week.


!image_2012-8-9_20-24-12.png!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51022].
  {panel}

It amazes me that such a powerful program is lacking some fundamental features. This issue can prolly be broken up into sub issues - but I will leave that up to someone else to do. 

I really love what jira and confluence has done to our workflow but at the same time it has also hurt our workflow with simple, yet missing, features.

1: Reminders. It is ultimately important that people get reminded about an events if a reminder is setup in a calendar. Many people are mobile now days and subscribe to the team calendars or a personal calendar. For instance I am out of the office in meetings all the time and with the new team calendars I never get reminded of my next meeting. This is quite annoying as it is something that I rely on a daily basis. Why such a simple and powerful feature is missing escapes me.

2: Making changes to the calendar. Again being mobile quite a bit I may have a client call and want to change their appointment to another time. I have my phone subscribed - but I can't make changes in my phones calendar and therefore I have to resort to going to the website and putting in my login information etc and making the change. This adds time and unnecessary steps.

3: Adding the time to the fields is a bit cumbersome sometimes. When I enter time into the team calendars I always have to remember to type it in properly in military time. When in other systems a simple drop down of time broken up in 15 minute blocks I can easily select from.

These 3 above are so utterly important - not just to use (who come from using Google Calendar) but I am almost certain for many other people as well.

I hope that these get implemented soon.
fields.summary: Missing features from team calendar
Ability to see who created a calendar event
Ability to send a daily email, weekly email with all events scheduled
Make calendar features more discoverable
Drag and dropping JIRA events should not reload the calendar
Event who field configuration restriction
